critique: This executive order pertains to the conversion of certain government employee appointments to career or career-conditional appointments. It primarily affects civil service employees and postal workers. There's no immediately obvious ideological tilt, immigration component, or impact on national security vs. civil liberties. It seems to have a slight impact on federalism by giving the Civil Service Commission power to prescribe regulations. It also seems to have a slight impact on economic regulation by potentially increasing job security for some government employees. It does not seem to have any impact on social inclusion. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:
